humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides a tumor size of 2.6 cm in greatest dimension, which falls within the range for T2 tumors (more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm). The presence of invasive lobular carcinoma also follows the same rules as invasive ductal carcinoma, based on the largest tumor size. The T stage is determined by the size of the largest tumor, regardless of the type of carcinoma. Therefore, the T stage for this patient's cancer is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage of a cancer is determined by the size of the tumor. In this report, the tumor size is stated as 'TUMOR SIZE: 2.6 cm'. According to the TNM staging system, a tumor size of 2.1 to 5.0 cm corresponds to a T2 stage. Therefore, the T stage for this patient's cancer is T2.
